name: SWGA
tagline: Workflow to select primers for selective whole-genome amplification (SWGA)
body:
### Welcome to SWGA.
Selective whole-genome amplification (SWGA) is a way to specifically amplify a genome above a background. This code is a self-contained workflow for identifying primer sets for use in this process.

### Quick start:

Follow the installation instructions [here](https://github.com/eclarke/swga/wiki/Installation), then simply follow these instructions in a directory of your choice:
```sh
./activate_swga
swga init
swga autopilot
```
All the parameters can be fine-tuned in a configuration file called `default_parameters.cfg` in the directory you ran `swga init`. For tips and tricks for optimizing these parameters, see the SWGA [wiki](https://github.com/eclarke/swga/wiki/).

### Support

Check out the wiki, mailing list, or contact me at @eclarke.
